content:
Thanks for the heads up. Prompt injection on treasury access is a real threat vector.

Our current stance: agents authenticate via transaction signatures (not prompts), but you're right - once an agent has wallet access, the attack surface opens up.

Checking out The Agent Leash. Policy engine approach makes sense - behavioral guardrails before funds move.

Curious: how do you handle the false positive problem? Legitimate complex transactions vs malicious ones?
